StochasticDFO.regression package

Submodules

StochasticDFO.regression.regression module

class RegDeriv(dim)

Bases: object

Calculates the derivatives using regression-based method

gradient

Regression-based gradient vector

Type:

1D numpy array

hessian

Regression-based hessian matrix

Type:

2D numpy array

dim

Dimension of the domain of the decision-variable

Type:

int

idx_triu

Indices for upper triangular array with diagonal offset

Type:

2-tuple of numpy arrays

idx_tril

Indices for lower triangular array with diagonal offset

Type:

2-tuple of numpy arrays

idx_diag

Indices for diagonal entries of array

Type:

2-tuple of numpy arrays

cond_first_order(nbr, weights)

Calculates the condition number of the weighted first-order regression matrix

Parameters:

  • nbr (numpy array) – Neighboring/perturbation points.

  • weights (numpy array) – Weights given to design points

Returns:

out – Condition number of the weighted first-order regression matrix

Return type:

float

cond_second_order(nbr, weights)

Calculates the condition number of the weighted second-order regression matrix

Parameters:

  • nbr (numpy array) – Neighboring/perturbation points.

  • weights (numpy array) – Weights given to design points

Returns:

out – Condition number of the weighted second-order regression matrix

Return type:

float

first_order(nbr, weights, fn_diff)

Calculates the first order regression gradient, i.e., nabla hat f_n(x_n) = ((Y_n.TW_nY_n)^-1)Y_n.TW_n hat f(x,Y_n,N_n).

Parameters:

  • nbr (numpy array) – Neighboring/perturbation points.

  • weights (numpy array) – Weights given to design points

  • fn_diff (numpy array) – Function differences hat f(x,Y_n,N_n)=hat f(x+y_n,N_n)-hat f(x,N_n)

iterative_method(nbr, weights, fn_diff)

Uses iterative least squares to calculate the second order regression gradient as defined in eqn. (55) in the tech report.

Parameters:

  • nbr (numpy array) – Neighboring/perturbation points.

  • weights (numpy array) – Weights given to design points

  • fn_diff (numpy array) – Function differences hat f(x,Y_n,N_n)=hat f(x+y_n,N_n)-hat f(x,N_n)

second_order(nbr, weights, fn_diff)

Calculates the second order regression gradient as defined in eqn. ( 55) in the tech report.

Parameters:

  • nbr (numpy array) – Neighboring/perturbation points.

  • weights (numpy array) – Weights given to design points

  • fn_diff (numpy array) – Function differences hat f(x,Y_n,N_n)=hat f(x+y_n,N_n)-hat f(x,N_n)
